alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 11 at 10:31PM MDT until June 15 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM MDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Colorado, including the following counties, in north central Colorado, Larimer. In northeast Colorado, Weld. * WHEN...Until 430 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1031 PM MDT, Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Windsor, Severance, Timnath and New Windsor Reservoir.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
